bibl.title: Letter from J.A. LePrince to Henry Rose Carter, January 9, 1923

div1.p: LePrince needs Carter's specifications for an anti-malaria campaign to use for a cost estimate to Congress. He sends Carter a copy of the letter that requests the estimate.

div1.head: Letter from J.A. LePrince to Henry Rose Carter, January 9, 1923
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN CHARGE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
Memphis, Tenn.
January, 9, 1923.
Dr. H.R. Carter,
Assistant Surgeon General,
U.S. Public Health Service,
2121 California, Ave., N W.
Washington, D.C.
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
Dr. A.M. Stimson has written Dr. Fricks relative
to the Muscle Shoals Project and I enclose copy of Dr. Stimsons
letter to you.

If you will be so kind as to let me know appro-
xmately of the data and requirements you gave to Colonel J.F. Siler
or Colonel Beach I can arrange any recommendations I make to correspond, in
case I am called on to make field surveys.
